text: The 2014–15 New Zealand Football Championship season (currently known as the ASB Premiership for sponsorship reasons) was the eleventh season of the NZFC since its establishment in 2004. Nine teams are involved this season, which includes the newly formed Wellington Phoenix reserve team. Auckland City and Team Wellington will represent the ASB Premiership in the 2014–15 OFC Champions League after finishing Champions and Runners-up respectively in the 2013–14 competition. ==Clubs== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align: left;" |- !width=175|Team !!Location !!Stadium !!Capacity !!Manager !!Kit manufacturer !!Shirt sponsor |- |border Auckland City ||Sandringham, Auckland ||Kiwitea Street ||align=center|3,500 || Ramon Tribulietx ||Nike ||Trillian Trust Inc. |- |border Canterbury United ||Christchurch ||ASB Football Park ||align=center|9,000 || Sean Devine ||Samurai ||Robbie's Bar and Bistro |- |border Hawke's Bay United ||Napier ||Bluewater Stadium ||align=center|5,000 || Brett Angell ||Lotto Sport Italia ||Kinetic Electrical |- |border Southern United ||Dunedin ||Forsyth Barr Stadium ||align=center|30,500 || Mike Fridge||Lotto Sport Italia ||Gran's Remedy |- |border Team Wellington ||Wellington ||David Farrington Park ||align=center|3,000 || Matt Calcott ||Nike ||Exodus Health & Fitness Club |- |border WaiBOP United ||Cambridge ||John Kerkhof Park ||align=center|2,700 || Peter Smith ||Lotto Sport Italia ||The Soccer Shop |- |border Waitakere United ||Whenuapai, Auckland ||Fred Taylor Park ||align=center|2,500 || Brian Shelley || Lotto Sport Italia || Cuesports Foundation |- |border Wanderers SC ||Albany, Auckland ||QBE Stadium ||align=center|25,000 || Darren Bazeley ||Nike ||Trillian Trust Inc. |- |border Wellington Phoenix ||Wellington ||Newtown Park ||align=center|5,000 || Andy Hedge ||Adidas ||Huawei |} ===Kits=== {|class="toccolours" style="text-valign: center;" cellpadding=1 cellspacing=1 | | | | | |- | | | | |} ==Regular season== ===League table=== ===Positions by round=== ===Fixtures and results=== The 2014–15 season sees every team play the other both home and away. With the introduction of the Wellington Phoenix Reserves side creating an uneven number of teams, each team has two byes in the regular season. However, due to Auckland City FC's participation in the 2014 OFC President's Cup and the 2014 FIFA Club World Cup, several matches and byes have been rescheduled. ====Round 4 (rescheduled)==== equalling red, and 3 points for a straight red card.
